title: MKR IoT Carrier Rev2
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier Rev2 leaves you free to focus on prototyping and programming your IoT projects.

title: MKR Therm Shield
description: The MKR Therm Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect high quality thermocouplers, and can calculate temperatures from -200°C to +700°C. An ideal solution to use for ovens, freezers, smokers and similar environments.

title: MKR ETH Shield
description: The MKR ETH Shield is a great solution for projects that require high-speed and reliable connections, such as industrial systems. It features an Ethernet connector, and can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: MKR SD Proto Shield
description: The MKR SD Proto Shield simply features a Micro SD card holder: the rest is up to you. You can mount smaller displays, or pack it with sensors and actuators of your own choice. It can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: MKR ENV Shield
description: The MKR ENV Shield is a perfect addon for the MKR family series, and is capable of reading temperature, humidity, light and pressure. The data is acquired easily through an easy-to-use library, and has an SD card slot for offline data logging.

title: MKR CAN Shield
description: The MKR CAN Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect to a CAN (Controller Area Network) bus, widely used in the automotive industry.

title: MKR Zero
description: The Arduino MKR Zero is a development board for music makers! With an SD card holder and dedicated SPI interfaces (SPI1), you are able to play music files without extra hardware.

title: MKR WiFi 1010
description: Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the MKR WiFi 1010 is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: MKR Vidor 4000
description: The Arduino MKR VIDOR 4000 is without a doubt the most advanced and featured-packed board in the MKR family, and the only one with a FPGA chip on board. With a camera & HDMI connector, a Wi-Fi / Bluetooth® module and up to 25 configurable pins, the sky is really the limit with this board.

title: MKR NB 1500
description: The Arduino MKR NB 1500 adds Narrowband communication to your projects. It can communicate over NB-IoT and LTE-M networks, and is excellent to use for low-power projects in remote areas. The MKR NB 1500 is also compatible with the Arduino IoT Cloud, making it easy to access wherever you are in the world.

title: MKR Relay Shield
description: The MKR Relay Shield has two relays mounted that can be used for loads up to 24V. It also features two status LEDs and a prototyping area for adding your own components.

title: MKR GSM 1400
description: The Arduino MKR GSM 1400 is a great starting point for building IoT projects connected to GSM / 3G network. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network for agricultural projects, or for urban data collection, the MKR GSM 1400 is your go-to board for IoT projects when Wi-Fi is not available.

title: MKR FOX 1200
description: The MKR FOX 1200 is your entry point to start working with the European Sigfox networks. The board can easily be added to the Sigfox infrastructure. It also features very low power consumption, and is designed to run on batteries for a longer period of time.

title: MKR 485 Shield
description: The MKR 485 Shield makes it possible to communicate with legacy industrial systems that uses the RS-485 protocol. The shield is simply mounted on a MKR family board, easily turning your old local system into a modern IoT system.

title: MKR WAN 1300
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1300 was the first LoRa® board released by Arduino, as a practical and cost effective solution with minimal power requirements. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: MKR WAN 1310
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1310 provides a practical and cost effective solution to add LoRa® connectivity to projects requiring low power. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: MKR 1000 WiFi
description: The Arduino MKR 1000 WiFi is the easiest point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network application design. Whether you are looking at setting up a sensor network for your office or building a smart home, the MKR 1000 WiFi will make that journey easy.

title: Make Your UNO Kit
description: Build your own Arduino UNO from scratch using raw electronic components! The Make Your UNO Kit includes all electronic components needed to build the classic UNO board, a long with 3D instructions, video & text content to support your journey.

title: IoT Bundle
description: Arduino IoT Bundle allows you to build your next smart project. Ever wanted an automated house? Or a smart garden? Well, now it’s easy with the Arduino IoT Cloud compatible boards. It means: you can connect devices, visualize data, control and share your projects from anywhere in the world. Whether you’re a beginner or a pro, we have a wide range of plans to make sure you get the features you need.

title: Nicla Sense ME
description: The Nicla Sense ME houses 4 low power sensors in a small footprint enabling powerful data fusion capabilities on the edge. Analyse '

title: WisGate Edge Pro
description: The WisGate Edge Pro gateway for LoRaWAN® embeds RAKWireless

title: Braccio Carrier
description: The Arduino® Braccio Carrier enables you to quickly and efficiently pursue your projects and ideas within e.g. robotics and automation with the Braccio ++. The carrier is equipped with connectors, a display and joystick to enhance the experience.

title: Opta
description: The

title: Portenta Machine Control
description: The Portenta Machine Control is a fully-centralized, low-power, industrial control unit able to drive equipment and machinery. It can be programmed using the Arduino framework or other embedded development platforms.

title: Edge Control Enclosure Kit
description: The edge control Enclosure kit provides a full enclosure for the Edge control.

title: Portenta Vision Shield
description: The Portenta Vision Shield brings industry-rated features to your Arduino Portenta. This hardware add-on will let you run embedded computer vision applications, connect wirelessly or via Ethernet to the Arduino Cloud or your own infrastructure, and activate your system upon the detection of sound events.

title: Edge Control
description: A remote monitoring and control solution, optimized for outdoor environments. Collect real-time data from smart sensors and leverage all on the edge.

title: Portenta Max Carrier
description: Transform your Portenta board to a edge computer solution with the Portenta Max Carrier.

title: Portenta H7 Lite Connected
description: The Portenta H7 Lite Connected follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Portenta X8
description: Portenta X8 offers the best of two approaches: flexibility of usage with Linux combined with real-time applications through the Arduino environment. The board comes with a Linux OS (Yocto) distribution, already preloaded onboard.

title: Portenta Cat. M1/NB IoT GNSS Shield
description: Unleash global connectivity and localization capabilities of your Portenta or MKR board with the Arduino® Portenta Cat. M1/NB IoT GNSS Shield. This shield enables cellular connectivity to both Cat. M1 and NB-IoT networks with the option to use eSIM technology. Easily track your valuable assets across the city worldwide with your choice of GPS, GLONASS, Galileo or BeiDou.

title: Portenta Breakout
description: Arduino Portenta Breakout board is designed to help hardware engineers and makers to prototype and help test devices connections and capacity within the Portenta family boards (e.g. the Portenta H7).

title: WisGate Edge Lite 2
description: The WisGate Edge Lite 2 gateway for LoRaWAN® embeds RAKwireless

title: Portenta H7
description: The Portenta H7 follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Nicla Voice
description: The Arduino® Nicla Voice packs speech and motion recognition capabilities on the edge into a tiny form factor. The board integrates a dedicated Neural Decision Processor

title: Nicla Vision
description: The Arduino® Nicla Vision is a ready-to-use, standalone camera for analyzing and processing images on the edge. Thanks to its 2MP color camera, smart 6-axis motion sensor, integrated microphone and distance sensor, it is suitable for asset tracking, object recognition and predictive maintenance. Quickly implement sensor nodes to send collected data to the Arduino® Cloud (or third-party vendor services) via integrated WiFi/BLE connectivity.

title: Portenta H7 Lite
description: The Portenta H7 Lite follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Nano Screw Terminal Adapter
description: The Nano Screw Terminal Adapter is a simple design that allows you to create robust designs with your Nano boards.

title: Nano Motor Carrier
description: The Nano Motor Carrier provides a quick and easy way to connect and control motors in your Engineering Kit R2.

title: Nano Every
description: The Nano Every is Arduino's smallest board with dimensions of only 45x18mm and a weight under 5gr. The small footprint and low price, make the Nano Every particularly suited for wearable inventions, low cost robotics and interactive projects requiring a small and easy to use microcontroller board.

title: Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2 combines a tiny form factor, different environment sensors and the possibility to run AI using TinyML and TensorFlow™ Lite. Whether you are looking at creating your first embedded ML application or you want to use Bluetooth® Low Energy to connect your project to your phone, the Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2 will make that journey easy.

title: Nano 33 BLE
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE shares its pinout with the classic Arduino Nano but builds on the nRF52840 microcontroller with 1MB CPU Flash Memory. Featuring a 9 axis inertial measurement unit and the possibility for Bluetooth® Low Energy connectivity it can help you to create your next Bluetooth® Low Energy enabled project.

title: 9 Axis Motion Shield
description: Allow your Arduino to measure movement: orientation, acceleration and magnetic field!

title: 4 Relays Shield
description: The Arduino 4 Relays Shield allows your Arduino driving high power loads.

title: Nano
description: The Arduino Nano is Arduino's classic breadboard friendly designed board with the smallest dimensions. The Arduino Nano comes with pin headers that allow for an easy attachment onto a breadboard and features a Mini-B USB connector.

title: Nano 33 IoT
description: The Arduino Nano 33 IoT combines the Arduino Nano form factor with an easy point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network applications. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the Nano 33 IoT is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: Motor Shield Rev3
description: The Arduino Motor Shield allows your arduino to drive DC and stepper motors, relays and solenoids.

title: Nano 33 BLE Sense
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense combines a tiny form factor, different environment sensors and the possibility to run AI using TinyML and TensorFlow™ Lite. Whether you are looking at creating your first embedded ML application or you want to use Bluetooth® Low Energy to connect your project to your phone, the Nano 33 BLE Sense will make that journey easy.

title: Ethernet Shield Rev2
description: Have an idea for a network project? Connect your Arduino to an ethernet shield and you will quickly be able to start sending sensor data to your network to interact with other gadgets in your home.

title: Zero
description: Arduino Zero is a simple and powerful 32-bit extension of the platform established by the UNO. This board aims to provide a platform for innovative projects in smart IoT devices, wearable technology, high-tech automation, crazy robotics, and much more.

title: Yún Rev2
description: The Yún Rev2, Linux powered board with the Arduino simplicity, is the perfect board for your IoT projects!

title: UNO WiFi Rev2
description: The Arduino UNO WiFi Rev 2 is the easiest point of entry to basic IoT with the standard form factor of the UNO family. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the Arduino UNO WiFi Rev 2 is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: UNO R3
description: The Arduino UNO is the best board to get started with electronics and coding. If this is your first experience tinkering with the platform, the UNO is the most robust board you can start playing with. The UNO is the most used and documented board of the whole Arduino family.

title: Leonardo
description: The Leonardo differs from all preceding boards in that the ATmega32u4 has built-in USB communication, eliminating the need for a secondary processor. This allows the Leonardo to appear to a connected computer as a mouse and keyboard, in addition to a virtual (CDC) serial / COM port.

title: Micro
description: The Micro runs on an ATmega32u4 processor with native USB communication. Configure via software whether the board is recognised as a standard Arduino, a mouse or keyboard.

title: Nano RP2040 Connect
description: The Arduino Nano RP2040 Connect is the feature packed Arduino Nano board built with Raspberry Pi's new silicon.

title: Mega 2560 Rev3
description: The 8-bit board with 54 digital pins, 16 analog inputs, and 4 serial ports.

title: Due
description: The Arduino Due is the first Arduino board based on a 32-bit ARM core microcontroller. With 54 digital input/output pins, 12 analog inputs, 2 DAC and 2 CAN it is the perfect board for powerful larger scale Arduino projects.

title: MKR Motor Carrier
description: The MKR Motor Carrier makes it easy to control servo, DC and stepper motors. With a number of different built in motor drivers, several easy connectors for motors and batteries and support for encoders, this powerhouse of a carrier is a must for any MKR projects involving motors.

title: MKR IoT Carrier Rev2
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier Rev2 leaves you free to focus on prototyping and programming your IoT projects.

title: UNO R3 SMD
description: The Arduino UNO is the best board to get started with electronics and coding. If this is your first experience tinkering with the platform, the UNO is the most robust board you can start playing with. The UNO is the most used and documented board of the whole Arduino family.

title: MKR IoT Carrier
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier leave you free to focus on prototyping and programming your next IoT projects.

title: UNO Mini Limited Edition
description: The Arduino UNO Mini Limited Edition (LE) is a unique black & gold board, that pays tribute to everyones favorite maker board:

title: MKR RGB Shield
description: The MKR RGB Shield is a great for creating simple light installations out of the box! With 84 programmable RGBs in a 12x7 matrix, you can use it to create scrolling texts, create simple animations or even use it to create retro games.

title: MKR Relay Shield
description: The MKR Relay Shield has two relays mounted that can be used for loads up to 24V. It also features two status LEDs and a prototyping area for adding your own components.

title: MKR MEM Shield
description: Add extra flash memory (2MB) and store larger files on a Micro SD card with the MKR MEM Shield. As a bonus, the shield has a prototyping area, for adding e.g. smaller displays, sensors, actuators and more. Compatible with all MKR family boards.

title: MKR IMU Shield
description: The MKR IMU Shield helps you integrate inertial measurements with your projects. Read three-dimensional acceleration, yaw rate and magnetical field by simply mounting it on top of a MKR family board.

title: MKR GPS Shield
description: The MKR GPS Shield is based on the u-blox SAM-M8Q GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) module. It can be used to add GPS to any of your MKR boards.

title: MKR Connector Carrier
description: The MKR Connector Carrier is a really useful extension for MKR family boards. It features 14 grove compatible connectors, which allows you to choose between hundreds of different sensors and actuators for your project.

description: The Yún Rev2, Linux powered board with the Arduino simplicity, is the perfect board for your IoT projects!

title: Mega 2560 Rev3

title: UNO R3 SMD

title: UNO Mini Limited Edition

title: Micro
description: The Micro runs on an ATmega32u4 processor with native USB communication. Configure via software whether the board is recognised as a standard Arduino, a mouse or keyboard.

title: Leonardo
description: The Leonardo differs from all preceding boards in that the ATmega32u4 has built-in USB communication, eliminating the need for a secondary processor. This allows the Leonardo to appear to a connected computer as a mouse and keyboard, in addition to a virtual (CDC) serial / COM port.

title: MKR SD Proto Shield
description: The MKR SD Proto Shield simply features a Micro SD card holder: the rest is up to you. You can mount smaller displays, or pack it with sensors and actuators of your own choice. It can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: Due
description: The Arduino Due is the first Arduino board based on a 32-bit ARM core microcontroller. With 54 digital input/output pins, 12 analog inputs, 2 DAC and 2 CAN it is the perfect board for powerful larger scale Arduino projects.

title: MKR Motor Carrier
description: The MKR Motor Carrier makes it easy to control servo, DC and stepper motors. With a number of different built in motor drivers, several easy connectors for motors and batteries and support for encoders, this powerhouse of a carrier is a must for any MKR projects involving motors.

title: MKR IoT Carrier Rev2
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier Rev2 leaves you free to focus on prototyping and programming your IoT projects.

title: MKR IoT Carrier
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier leave you free to focus on prototyping and programming your next IoT projects.

title: MKR Connector Carrier
description: The MKR Connector Carrier is a really useful extension for MKR family boards. It features 14 grove compatible connectors, which allows you to choose between hundreds of different sensors and actuators for your project.

title: MKR Relay Shield
description: The MKR Relay Shield has two relays mounted that can be used for loads up to 24V. It also features two status LEDs and a prototyping area for adding your own components.

title: MKR MEM Shield
description: Add extra flash memory (2MB) and store larger files on a Micro SD card with the MKR MEM Shield. As a bonus, the shield has a prototyping area, for adding e.g. smaller displays, sensors, actuators and more. Compatible with all MKR family boards.

title: MKR Therm Shield
description: The MKR Therm Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect high quality thermocouplers, and can calculate temperatures from -200°C to +700°C. An ideal solution to use for ovens, freezers, smokers and similar environments.

title: MKR CAN Shield
description: The MKR CAN Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect to a CAN (Controller Area Network) bus, widely used in the automotive industry.

title: MKR RGB Shield
description: The MKR RGB Shield is a great for creating simple light installations out of the box! With 84 programmable RGBs in a 12x7 matrix, you can use it to create scrolling texts, create simple animations or even use it to create retro games.

title: MKR GPS Shield
description: The MKR GPS Shield is based on the u-blox SAM-M8Q GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) module. It can be used to add GPS to any of your MKR boards.

title: MKR WiFi 1010
description: Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the MKR WiFi 1010 is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: MKR IMU Shield
description: The MKR IMU Shield helps you integrate inertial measurements with your projects. Read three-dimensional acceleration, yaw rate and magnetical field by simply mounting it on top of a MKR family board.

title: MKR ETH Shield
description: The MKR ETH Shield is a great solution for projects that require high-speed and reliable connections, such as industrial systems. It features an Ethernet connector, and can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: MKR ENV Shield
description: The MKR ENV Shield is a perfect addon for the MKR family series, and is capable of reading temperature, humidity, light and pressure. The data is acquired easily through an easy-to-use library, and has an SD card slot for offline data logging.

title: MKR 485 Shield
description: The MKR 485 Shield makes it possible to communicate with legacy industrial systems that uses the RS-485 protocol. The shield is simply mounted on a MKR family board, easily turning your old local system into a modern IoT system.

title: MKR Zero
description: The Arduino MKR Zero is a development board for music makers! With an SD card holder and dedicated SPI interfaces (SPI1), you are able to play music files without extra hardware.

title: MKR WAN 1310
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1310 provides a practical and cost effective solution to add LoRa® connectivity to projects requiring low power. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: MKR WAN 1300
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1300 was the first LoRa® board released by Arduino, as a practical and cost effective solution with minimal power requirements. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: MKR Vidor 4000
description: The Arduino MKR VIDOR 4000 is without a doubt the most advanced and featured-packed board in the MKR family, and the only one with a FPGA chip on board. With a camera & HDMI connector, a Wi-Fi / Bluetooth® module and up to 25 configurable pins, the sky is really the limit with this board.

title: MKR NB 1500
description: The Arduino MKR NB 1500 adds Narrowband communication to your projects. It can communicate over NB-IoT and LTE-M networks, and is excellent to use for low-power projects in remote areas. The MKR NB 1500 is also compatible with the Arduino IoT Cloud, making it easy to access wherever you are in the world.

title: MKR GSM 1400
description: The Arduino MKR GSM 1400 is a great starting point for building IoT projects connected to GSM / 3G network. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network for agricultural projects, or for urban data collection, the MKR GSM 1400 is your go-to board for IoT projects when Wi-Fi is not available.

title: MKR FOX 1200
description: The MKR FOX 1200 is your entry point to start working with the European Sigfox networks. The board can easily be added to the Sigfox infrastructure. It also features very low power consumption, and is designed to run on batteries for a longer period of time.

title: MKR 1000 WiFi
description: The Arduino MKR 1000 WiFi is the easiest point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network application design. Whether you are looking at setting up a sensor network for your office or building a smart home, the MKR 1000 WiFi will make that journey easy.

title: Opta
description: The

title: Portenta Cat. M1/NB IoT GNSS Shield
description: Unleash global connectivity and localization capabilities of your Portenta or MKR board with the Arduino® Portenta Cat. M1/NB IoT GNSS Shield. This shield enables cellular connectivity to both Cat. M1 and NB-IoT networks with the option to use eSIM technology. Easily track your valuable assets across the city worldwide with your choice of GPS, GLONASS, Galileo or BeiDou.

title: Nicla Sense ME
description: The Nicla Sense ME houses 4 low power sensors in a small footprint enabling powerful data fusion capabilities on the edge. Analyse '

title: Portenta Max Carrier
description: Transform your Portenta board to a edge computer solution with the Portenta Max Carrier.

title: Edge Control
description: A remote monitoring and control solution, optimized for outdoor environments. Collect real-time data from smart sensors and leverage all on the edge.

title: WisGate Edge Lite 2
description: The WisGate Edge Lite 2 gateway for LoRaWAN® embeds RAKwireless

title: Edge Control Enclosure Kit
description: The edge control Enclosure kit provides a full enclosure for the Edge control.

title: Portenta X8
description: Portenta X8 offers the best of two approaches: flexibility of usage with Linux combined with real-time applications through the Arduino environment. The board comes with a Linux OS (Yocto) distribution, already preloaded onboard.

title: Portenta Breakout
description: Arduino Portenta Breakout board is designed to help hardware engineers and makers to prototype and help test devices connections and capacity within the Portenta family boards (e.g. the Portenta H7).

title: Portenta Machine Control
description: The Portenta Machine Control is a fully-centralized, low-power, industrial control unit able to drive equipment and machinery. It can be programmed using the Arduino framework or other embedded development platforms.

title: Portenta Vision Shield
description: The Portenta Vision Shield brings industry-rated features to your Arduino Portenta. This hardware add-on will let you run embedded computer vision applications, connect wirelessly or via Ethernet to the Arduino Cloud or your own infrastructure, and activate your system upon the detection of sound events.

title: WisGate Edge Pro
description: The WisGate Edge Pro gateway for LoRaWAN® embeds RAKWireless

title: Nano Screw Terminal Adapter
description: The Nano Screw Terminal Adapter is a simple design that allows you to create robust designs with your Nano boards.

title: Portenta H7 Lite
description: The Portenta H7 Lite follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Portenta H7 Lite Connected
description: The Portenta H7 Lite Connected follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Make Your UNO Kit
description: Build your own Arduino UNO from scratch using raw electronic components! The Make Your UNO Kit includes all electronic components needed to build the classic UNO board, a long with 3D instructions, video & text content to support your journey.

title: Braccio Carrier
description: The Arduino® Braccio Carrier enables you to quickly and efficiently pursue your projects and ideas within e.g. robotics and automation with the Braccio ++. The carrier is equipped with connectors, a display and joystick to enhance the experience.

title: Portenta H7
description: The Portenta H7 follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Nano RP2040 Connect
description: The Arduino Nano RP2040 Connect is the feature packed Arduino Nano board built with Raspberry Pi's new silicon.

title: Nicla Voice
description: The Arduino® Nicla Voice packs speech and motion recognition capabilities on the edge into a tiny form factor. The board integrates a dedicated Neural Decision Processor

title: Nicla Vision
description: The Arduino® Nicla Vision is a ready-to-use, standalone camera for analyzing and processing images on the edge. Thanks to its 2MP color camera, smart 6-axis motion sensor, integrated microphone and distance sensor, it is suitable for asset tracking, object recognition and predictive maintenance. Quickly implement sensor nodes to send collected data to the Arduino® Cloud (or third-party vendor services) via integrated WiFi/BLE connectivity.

title: IoT Bundle
description: Arduino IoT Bundle allows you to build your next smart project. Ever wanted an automated house? Or a smart garden? Well, now it’s easy with the Arduino IoT Cloud compatible boards. It means: you can connect devices, visualize data, control and share your projects from anywhere in the world. Whether you’re a beginner or a pro, we have a wide range of plans to make sure you get the features you need.

title: Nano Motor Carrier
description: The Nano Motor Carrier provides a quick and easy way to connect and control motors in your Engineering Kit R2.

title: Nano 33 BLE Sense
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense combines a tiny form factor, different environment sensors and the possibility to run AI using TinyML and TensorFlow™ Lite. Whether you are looking at creating your first embedded ML application or you want to use Bluetooth® Low Energy to connect your project to your phone, the Nano 33 BLE Sense will make that journey easy.

title: Nano Every
description: The Nano Every is Arduino's smallest board with dimensions of only 45x18mm and a weight under 5gr. The small footprint and low price, make the Nano Every particularly suited for wearable inventions, low cost robotics and interactive projects requiring a small and easy to use microcontroller board.

title: Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2 combines a tiny form factor, different environment sensors and the possibility to run AI using TinyML and TensorFlow™ Lite. Whether you are looking at creating your first embedded ML application or you want to use Bluetooth® Low Energy to connect your project to your phone, the Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2 will make that journey easy.

title: Nano 33 IoT
description: The Arduino Nano 33 IoT combines the Arduino Nano form factor with an easy point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network applications. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the Nano 33 IoT is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: 9 Axis Motion Shield
description: Allow your Arduino to measure movement: orientation, acceleration and magnetic field!

title: Nano 33 BLE
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE shares its pinout with the classic Arduino Nano but builds on the nRF52840 microcontroller with 1MB CPU Flash Memory. Featuring a 9 axis inertial measurement unit and the possibility for Bluetooth® Low Energy connectivity it can help you to create your next Bluetooth® Low Energy enabled project.

title: Motor Shield Rev3
description: The Arduino Motor Shield allows your arduino to drive DC and stepper motors, relays and solenoids.

title: Nano

Easily track your valuable assets across the city worldwide with your choice of GPS, GLONASS, Galileo or BeiDou.

title: Nano RP2040 Connect

title: Nano Every
description: The Nano Every is Arduino's smallest board with dimensions of only 45x18mm and a weight under 5gr. The small footprint and low price, make the Nano Every particularly suited for wearable inventions, low cost robotics and interactive projects requiring a small and easy to use microcontroller board.

title: Nano 33 IoT
description: The Arduino Nano 33 IoT combines the Arduino Nano form factor with an easy point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network applications. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the Nano 33 IoT is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: Nano 33 BLE Sense
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense combines a tiny form factor, different environment sensors and the possibility to run AI using TinyML and TensorFlow™ Lite. Whether you are looking at creating your first embedded ML application or you want to use Bluetooth® Low Energy to connect your project to your phone, the Nano 33 BLE Sense will make that journey easy.

title: Nano 33 BLE
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE shares its pinout with the classic Arduino Nano but builds on the nRF52840 microcontroller with 1MB CPU Flash Memory. Featuring a 9 axis inertial measurement unit and the possibility for Bluetooth® Low Energy connectivity it can help you to create your next Bluetooth® Low Energy enabled project.

title: Ethernet Shield Rev2
description: Have an idea for a network project? Connect your Arduino to an ethernet shield and you will quickly be able to start sending sensor data to your network to interact with other gadgets in your home.

title: UNO R3 SMD
description: The Arduino UNO is the best board to get started with electronics and coding. If this is your first experience tinkering with the platform, the UNO is the most robust board you can start playing with. The UNO is the most used and documented board of the whole Arduino family.

title: Leonardo
description: The Leonardo differs from all preceding boards in that the ATmega32u4 has built-in USB communication, eliminating the need for a secondary processor. This allows the Leonardo to appear to a connected computer as a mouse and keyboard, in addition to a virtual (CDC) serial / COM port.

title: UNO R3
description: The Arduino UNO is the best board to get started with electronics and coding. If this is your first experience tinkering with the platform, the UNO is the most robust board you can start playing with. The UNO is the most used and documented board of the whole Arduino family.

title: UNO Mini Limited Edition
description: The Arduino UNO Mini Limited Edition (LE) is a unique black & gold board, that pays tribute to everyones favorite maker board:

title: Micro
description: The Micro runs on an ATmega32u4 processor with native USB communication. Configure via software whether the board is recognised as a standard Arduino, a mouse or keyboard.

title: Mega 2560 Rev3
description: The 8-bit board with 54 digital pins, 16 analog inputs, and 4 serial ports.

title: MKR Motor Carrier
description: The MKR Motor Carrier makes it easy to control servo, DC and stepper motors. With a number of different built in motor drivers, several easy connectors for motors and batteries and support for encoders, this powerhouse of a carrier is a must for any MKR projects involving motors.

title: MKR IoT Carrier
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier leave you free to focus on prototyping and programming your next IoT projects.

title: MKR Connector Carrier
description: The MKR Connector Carrier is a really useful extension for MKR family boards. It features 14 grove compatible connectors, which allows you to choose between hundreds of different sensors and actuators for your project.

title: MKR Therm Shield
description: The MKR Therm Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect high quality thermocouplers, and can calculate temperatures from -200°C to +700°C. An ideal solution to use for ovens, freezers, smokers and similar environments.

title: MKR RGB Shield
description: The MKR RGB Shield is a great for creating simple light installations out of the box! With 84 programmable RGBs in a 12x7 matrix, you can use it to create scrolling texts, create simple animations or even use it to create retro games.

title: MKR SD Proto Shield
description: The MKR SD Proto Shield simply features a Micro SD card holder: the rest is up to you. You can mount smaller displays, or pack it with sensors and actuators of your own choice. It can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: MKR MEM Shield
description: Add extra flash memory (2MB) and store larger files on a Micro SD card with the MKR MEM Shield. As a bonus, the shield has a prototyping area, for adding e.g. smaller displays, sensors, actuators and more. Compatible with all MKR family boards.

title: MKR Relay Shield
description: The MKR Relay Shield has two relays mounted that can be used for loads up to 24V. It also features two status LEDs and a prototyping area for adding your own components.

title: MKR IMU Shield
description: The MKR IMU Shield helps you integrate inertial measurements with your projects. Read three-dimensional acceleration, yaw rate and magnetical field by simply mounting it on top of a MKR family board.

title: MKR IoT Carrier Rev2
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier Rev2 leaves you free to focus on prototyping and programming your IoT projects.

title: MKR ETH Shield
description: The MKR ETH Shield is a great solution for projects that require high-speed and reliable connections, such as industrial systems. It features an Ethernet connector, and can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: MKR GPS Shield
description: The MKR GPS Shield is based on the u-blox SAM-M8Q GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) module. It can be used to add GPS to any of your MKR boards.

title: MKR ENV Shield
description: The MKR ENV Shield is a perfect addon for the MKR family series, and is capable of reading temperature, humidity, light and pressure. The data is acquired easily through an easy-to-use library, and has an SD card slot for offline data logging.

title: MKR CAN Shield
description: The MKR CAN Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect to a CAN (Controller Area Network) bus, widely used in the automotive industry.

title: MKR Vidor 4000
description: The Arduino MKR VIDOR 4000 is without a doubt the most advanced and featured-packed board in the MKR family, and the only one with a FPGA chip on board. With a camera & HDMI connector, a Wi-Fi / Bluetooth® module and up to 25 configurable pins, the sky is really the limit with this board.

title: MKR Zero
description: The Arduino MKR Zero is a development board for music makers! With an SD card holder and dedicated SPI interfaces (SPI1), you are able to play music files without extra hardware.

title: MKR WiFi 1010
description: Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the MKR WiFi 1010 is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: MKR WAN 1310
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1310 provides a practical and cost effective solution to add LoRa® connectivity to projects requiring low power. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: MKR WAN 1300
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1300 was the first LoRa® board released by Arduino, as a practical and cost effective solution with minimal power requirements. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: Due
description: The Arduino Due is the first Arduino board based on a 32-bit ARM core microcontroller. With 54 digital input/output pins, 12 analog inputs, 2 DAC and 2 CAN it is the perfect board for powerful larger scale Arduino projects.

title: MKR NB 1500
description: The Arduino MKR NB 1500 adds Narrowband communication to your projects. It can communicate over NB-IoT and LTE-M networks, and is excellent to use for low-power projects in remote areas. The MKR NB 1500 is also compatible with the Arduino IoT Cloud, making it easy to access wherever you are in the world.

title: MKR GSM 1400
description: The Arduino MKR GSM 1400 is a great starting point for building IoT projects connected to GSM / 3G network. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network for agricultural projects, or for urban data collection, the MKR GSM 1400 is your go-to board for IoT projects when Wi-Fi is not available.

title: MKR FOX 1200
description: The MKR FOX 1200 is your entry point to start working with the European Sigfox networks. The board can easily be added to the Sigfox infrastructure. It also features very low power consumption, and is designed to run on batteries for a longer period of time.

title: MKR 1000 WiFi
description: The Arduino MKR 1000 WiFi is the easiest point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network application design. Whether you are looking at setting up a sensor network for your office or building a smart home, the MKR 1000 WiFi will make that journey easy.

title: MKR 485 Shield
description: The MKR 485 Shield makes it possible to communicate with legacy industrial systems that uses the RS-485 protocol. The shield is simply mounted on a MKR family board, easily turning your old local system into a modern IoT system.

title: Make Your UNO Kit
description: Build your own Arduino UNO from scratch using raw electronic components! The Make Your UNO Kit includes all electronic components needed to build the classic UNO board, a long with 3D instructions, video & text content to support your journey.

title: Nicla Vision
description: The Arduino® Nicla Vision is a ready-to-use, standalone camera for analyzing and processing images on the edge. Thanks to its 2MP color camera, smart 6-axis motion sensor, integrated microphone and distance sensor, it is suitable for asset tracking, object recognition and predictive maintenance. Quickly implement sensor nodes to send collected data to the Arduino® Cloud (or third-party vendor services) via integrated WiFi/BLE connectivity.

title: IoT Bundle
description: Arduino IoT Bundle allows you to build your next smart project. Ever wanted an automated house? Or a smart garden? Well, now it’s easy with the Arduino IoT Cloud compatible boards. It means: you can connect devices, visualize data, control and share your projects from anywhere in the world. Whether you’re a beginner or a pro, we have a wide range of plans to make sure you get the features you need.

title: Nicla Vision
description: The Arduino® Nicla Vision is a ready-to-use, standalone camera for analyzing and processing images on the edge. Thanks to its 2MP color camera, smart 6-axis motion sensor, integrated microphone and distance sensor, it is suitable for asset tracking, object recognition and predictive maintenance. Quickly implement sensor nodes to send collected data to the Arduino® Cloud (or third-party vendor services) via integrated WiFi/BLE connectivity.

title: Portenta H7
description: The Portenta H7 follows the Arduino MKR form factor, but enhanced with the Portenta family 80 pin high-density connector. Program it with high-level languages and AI while performing low-latency operations on its customizable hardware.

title: Nano 33 IoT
description: The Arduino Nano 33 IoT combines the Arduino Nano form factor with an easy point of entry to basic IoT and pico-network applications. Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the Nano 33 IoT is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.

title: Portenta H7 Lite

title: Nano Every
description: The Nano Every is Arduino's smallest board with dimensions of only 45x18mm and a weight under 5gr. The small footprint and low price, make the Nano Every particularly suited for wearable inventions, low cost robotics and interactive projects requiring a small and easy to use microcontroller board.

title: Nano Screw Terminal Adapter

title: Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2
description: The Arduino Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2 combines a tiny form factor, different environment sensors and the possibility to run AI using TinyML and TensorFlow™ Lite. Whether you are looking at creating your first embedded ML application or you want to use Bluetooth® Low Energy to connect your project to your phone, the Nano 33 BLE Sense Rev2 will make that journey easy.

title: Leonardo
description: The Leonardo differs from all preceding boards in that the ATmega32u4 has built-in USB communication, eliminating the need for a secondary processor. This allows the Leonardo to appear to a connected computer as a mouse and keyboard, in addition to a virtual (CDC) serial / COM port.

title: Zero
description: Arduino Zero is a simple and powerful 32-bit extension of the platform established by the UNO. This board aims to provide a platform for innovative projects in smart IoT devices, wearable technology, high-tech automation, crazy robotics, and much more.

title: Due
description: The Arduino Due is the first Arduino board based on a 32-bit ARM core microcontroller. With 54 digital input/output pins, 12 analog inputs, 2 DAC and 2 CAN it is the perfect board for powerful larger scale Arduino projects.

title: MKR Motor Carrier
description: The MKR Motor Carrier makes it easy to control servo, DC and stepper motors. With a number of different built in motor drivers, several easy connectors for motors and batteries and support for encoders, this powerhouse of a carrier is a must for any MKR projects involving motors.

title: MKR SD Proto Shield
description: The MKR SD Proto Shield simply features a Micro SD card holder: the rest is up to you. You can mount smaller displays, or pack it with sensors and actuators of your own choice. It can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: Mega 2560 Rev3
description: The 8-bit board with 54 digital pins, 16 analog inputs, and 4 serial ports.

title: MKR IoT Carrier Rev2

title: MKR IoT Carrier
description: The sensors, circuits and display integrated on the MKR IoT Carrier leave you free to focus on prototyping and programming your next IoT projects.

title: MKR Connector Carrier
description: The MKR Connector Carrier is a really useful extension for MKR family boards. It features 14 grove compatible connectors, which allows you to choose between hundreds of different sensors and actuators for your project.

title: MKR RGB Shield
description: The MKR RGB Shield is a great for creating simple light installations out of the box! With 84 programmable RGBs in a 12x7 matrix, you can use it to create scrolling texts, create simple animations or even use it to create retro games.

title: MKR IMU Shield
description: The MKR IMU Shield helps you integrate inertial measurements with your projects. Read three-dimensional acceleration, yaw rate and magnetical field by simply mounting it on top of a MKR family board.

title: MKR GPS Shield
description: The MKR GPS Shield is based on the u-blox SAM-M8Q GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) module. It can be used to add GPS to any of your MKR boards.

title: MKR ENV Shield
description: The MKR ENV Shield is a perfect addon for the MKR family series, and is capable of reading temperature, humidity, light and pressure. The data is acquired easily through an easy-to-use library, and has an SD card slot for offline data logging.

title: MKR 485 Shield
description: The MKR 485 Shield makes it possible to communicate with legacy industrial systems that uses the RS-485 protocol. The shield is simply mounted on a MKR family board, easily turning your old local system into a modern IoT system.

title: MKR CAN Shield
description: The MKR CAN Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect to a CAN (Controller Area Network) bus, widely used in the automotive industry.

title: MKR ETH Shield
description: The MKR ETH Shield is a great solution for projects that require high-speed and reliable connections, such as industrial systems. It features an Ethernet connector, and can be simply mounted on top of any MKR family board.

title: MKR Therm Shield
description: The MKR Therm Shield is a great addon for MKR family boards, and allows you to connect high quality thermocouplers, and can calculate temperatures from -200°C to +700°C. An ideal solution to use for ovens, freezers, smokers and similar environments.

title: MKR WAN 1310
description: The Arduino MKR WAN 1310 provides a practical and cost effective solution to add LoRa® connectivity to projects requiring low power. This open source board can connect to the Arduino IoT Cloud, your own LoRa® network using the Arduino LoRa® PRO Gateway, existing LoRaWAN® infrastructure like The Things Network, or even other boards using the direct connectivity mode.

title: MKR Relay Shield
description: The MKR Relay Shield has two relays mounted that can be used for loads up to 24V. It also features two status LEDs and a prototyping area for adding your own components.

title: MKR MEM Shield
description: Add extra flash memory (2MB) and store larger files on a Micro SD card with the MKR MEM Shield. As a bonus, the shield has a prototyping area, for adding e.g. smaller displays, sensors, actuators and more. Compatible with all MKR family boards.

title: MKR Vidor 4000
description: The Arduino MKR VIDOR 4000 is without a doubt the most advanced and featured-packed board in the MKR family, and the only one with a FPGA chip on board. With a camera & HDMI connector, a Wi-Fi / Bluetooth® module and up to 25 configurable pins, the sky is really the limit with this board.

title: MKR WiFi 1010
description: Whether you are looking at building a sensor network connected to your office or home router, or if you want to create a Bluetooth® Low Energy device sending data to a cellphone, the MKR WiFi 1010 is your one-stop-solution for many of the basic IoT application scenarios.
